snippet: Mary Whipple is the coxswain for the U.S. women’s eight, the defending Olympic champions. Under her direction, the boat has not lost since 2006.
abstract: Coxswain Mary Whipple and the United States women’s eight rowing team are poised to defend their Olympic championship; under Whipple's direction, the boat has not lost since 2006.
lead_paragraph: Mary Whipple is the coxswain for the U.S. women’s eight, the defending Olympic champions. Under her direction, the boat has not lost since 2006.

headline.seo: Coxswain Mary Whipple Stands Tall for U.S. Rowers
headline.main: On Rowing Team, Smallest Body Has the Voice of Authority
headline.print_headline: Smallest Body in the Boat Has the Voice of Authority
